Tell Me More

Technology

At Watt-Learn, we are taking a multi-disciplinary approach to turn grid batteries into smart participants of the electricity grid using Proactive Lifetime-Aware Automation System (PLAAS)

Taking advantage of AI and Optimization solutions, our PLAAS technology offers proactive and optimal solutions for often-conflicting objectives derived by Energy Systems constraints, Energy Market dynamics, Economic & Operational objectives, and even uncertainties rooted in Human Behavior.

Watt-Learn’s technology is the first and only solution to balance between three Pilars of battery economy: The overall life of the project, the cost associated with the project, and the total value generated from the project.

Batteries equipped with Watt-Learn’s technology can generate 50%-150% more savings/revenue, while cycling 30%-65% less.

Solutions

As a result of a recent partnerships, availability of any of the following offerings is determined on case-by-case basis. Please don’t hesitate to reach out if you are interested in any of ur solutions.

  • Battery Performance Audit

    existing projects

    If you wonder what our PLAAS solution can do and what the size of unrealized opportunity is for your project, this is a service you would benefit from. We will work closely with you to customize our PLAAS solution to your project’s specifications and needs. We will go back in time and simulate the operation of your project using PLAAS with different configurations to demonstrate the value that could have been generated for your project in variety of scenarios (e.g., revenue/ saving, lifetime, cycles, etc.).

  • Real-time Recommendations

    existing projects

    If you feel that PLAAS is a right solution for your project (either because the results from the Battery Performance Audit is suggesting so, or because you believe in science!), but still prefer to have the control of your battery’s operation in your own hands, then this solution is for you. You will receive a forward-looking dispatch setpoints, on realtime basis, which act as recommendations that can be either incorporated into the battery control system, or used to shadow the existing strategies.

  • Proactive Lifetime-Aware Automation System (PLAAS)

    existing and future projects

    PLAAS is here to maximize the value of your battery project. PLAAS serves as an intelligence layer on top of the existing battery control system. It sends proactive setpoints to your battery’s management system to maximize a customized set of objectives for your very specific project (e.g., revenue/ savings, number of cycles, lifetime, carbon footprint, etc. or a combination of all). Our solution is non-intrusive, technology agnostic, and cloud-based.

  • Stay Tuned
    for New
    Solutions!

About

  • Humble beginnings

    2017

    Watt-Learn is a startup raised from Pittsburgh, Carnegie Mellon University (CMU). The founders, Julian Lamy and Matineh Eybpoosh, have decades of combined experience in tackling some of the most challenging problems in energy space. In 2016, through his studies of energy storage markets, Julian realises that one very important factor is missing for batteries: intelligence. Current batteries are simply too dumb to be profitable. Combining their multidisciplinary background, Julian and Matineh form a unique solution to address this very issue.

    Watt-Learn founders have their signature on many state-of-the-art solutions and products that have found market success in the industry. Their experience ranges from applying AI and optimization for optimal operation of energy systems, different power markets, development and operation of energy storage and renewable projects, as well as data-driven diagnosis of energy systems.

  • Our Journey

    2018

    Watt-Learn have been part of AlphaLab accelerator, as well as Plug & Play, where it won the People’s Choice Award as the best energy startup. Watt-Learn was invited to present at Energy Storage Summit held by Green Tech Media in 2017, was a finalist startup presenter at VERGE conference, and has won the first place at TransTech Energy Business Development Competition at Carnegie Mellon University, to name a few.

    Watt-Learn joined forces with one of the leader energy investment companies in the country. Thanks to this partnership, Watt-Learn’s software will be operating a large pipeline of front-of-the-meter projects across the US to maximize the ROI for the shareholders.

  • Be Part
    Of Our
    Story!

Our Amazing Team

Matineh Eybpoosh, Ph.D.

CEO, Co-founder

Matineh has years of experience in building a variety of machine-learning software solutions that address open challenges in the energy space. Before Watt-Learn, she was the Director of Data Science at kWantera - an Energy Management company where she led development of the company’s AI platform for energy market intelligence. She completed her Ph.D. at Carnegie Mellon University, where she developed machine-learning algorithms for proactive diagnosis of energy systems.

Puneeth Kalavase, Ph.D.

Lead Data Scientist

Puneeth is a clean-energy professional with demonstrated experience using software and data analysis in the service or reducing carbon emissions. Prior to Watt-Learn, Puneeth led the data science team at Stem, an early behind-the-meter energy storage provider. Before that, he was at Plotwatt, an energy efficiency analytics company. Before entering industry, Puneeth was a postdoctoral researcher at the Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory where he analyzed the impact of global appliance efficiency standards. Puneeth completed his Ph.D in Experimental High Energy Physics at UC Santa Barbara.

Bo Olsen

Senior Software Engineer

Bo's background is in high energy physics working on recreating moments after the big bang using experiments at CERN. Shortly after, he tried his luck in the energy field as a embedded engineer at Stem Inc. to control behind the meter storage. Since, Bo has been a consultant for several enegy startups before landing softly at Watt-Learn. At Watt-Learn he is leading the development of our cloud-based software infrastructure.

Career Opportunities

As an award-winning clean-tech startup, Watt-Learn is developing revolutionary AI-based software for the next generation of energy storage battery projects that will optimize the growth of renewable energy and reduce mankind’s reliance on fossil fuels.

We are looking for champions who are excited to make meaningful impacts on our mission by being part of Watt-Learn’s story in solving some of the world’s most pressing environmental challenges.

Watt-Learn is a startup founded by energy and software enthusiasts from Carnegie Mellon University and is now backed by one of the largest private energy investors in the country. That means Watt-Learn employees get the best of both worlds: security and benefits of a well-funded and stable company, and the excitement, visibility and growth opportunities of being part of a fast-growing and innovative startup.

Senior Data Scientist

  • Role:

    This role will be heavily involved with expanding and enhancing our existing AI-based platform, as well as a lot of greenfield development and building brand new and robust optimization and machine-learning algorithms and supporting code bases.

    Your work will include all levels of product lifecycle, from research and feasibility analysis all the way to data processing and data engineering, model development, debugging existing code base, framework development, testing and quality assurance, and production / post-production services.
    Your work will be highly visible throughout the company and will build the foundation for our go-to-market product. As one of the core members of the team, you will have direct input in building a roadmap to meet company milestones. You will be reporting directly to the CTO.

  • Available: Now
  • General Requirements:

    • An effective and motivated team player – We work as a team and grow as a team.
    • Self-driven, independent, and critical thinkers – There will be no daily todo list in this job.
    • Strong communication skills.
    • Experience in Energy Storage, Renewable Energy, Energy Efficiency, or Energy Industry in general is a strong plus.

  • Experience and Knowledge:

    • Demonstrated hands-on 4+ years of experience in similar roles, developing production-level machine-learning and optimization algorithms and the supporting code-base.
    • Deep understanding of object-oriented design, programming concepts, data structures and common algorithms.
    • Python proficiency is a must.
    • Experience with Python Pandas, and time-series modeling.
    • Proficiency in developing high performing machine-learning models with time-series data.
    • Proficiency in developing high performing linear and non-linear optimization algorithms for complex problems (familiarity with model predictive control is a strong plus).
    • Experience with collaborative working through Github, pull-requests, version controls, etc.
    • Demonstrated ability to design and develop high quality, highly scalable code with a focus on machine-learning, optimization, and other data science functions.
    • Experience with databases such as Postgres, Cassandra, and query languages such as CQL and SQL, big data frameworks, Hadoop, etc. is a strong plus.
    • Experience with AWS cloud is a strong plus.
    • Familiarity with Unix and virtual environments.

Software Engineer

  • Role:

    This role will be heavily involved with expanding and enhancing our existing software infrastructure, as well as a lot of greenfield development building robust features for our core software platform.
    You will be part of a technical team that will design and develop backend infrastructure software to communicate across all layers, database stack, cloud and log analytics of the server and network communication, and security provisions necessary to scale the company’s AI platform.

    Your work will be highly visible throughout the company and will build the foundation for our go-to-market product. As one of the core members of the team, you will have direct input in building a roadmap to meet company milestones.
    You will be reporting directly to the CTO.

  • Available: Now
  • General Requirements:

    An effective and motivated team player – We work as a team and grow as a team.
    Self-driven, independent, and critical thinkers – There will be no daily todo list in this job.
    Strong communication skills. Leadership and project management experience is a strong plus.

  • Experience and Knowledge:

    • Demonstrated hands-on 4+ years of experience in similar roles, developing production-level backend infrastructure Familiar with all layers of computer software development, and ability to turn a concept into a finished scalable product.
    • Must have experience with deploying, monitoring, and building robust fault tolerant microservice architectures in AWS (familiarity with other cloud offerings is a plus).
    • Demonstrated ability to design and develop high quality, highly scalable code with a focus on backend development, involving high data volumes and transaction rates with asynchronous workloads.
    • Past experience with setting up CI/CD processes (e.g., Jenkins, Travis, CircleCi), and collaborative working through Git, pull-requests, version controls, etc.
    • Experience with time series data, and databases suited for this type of data is a must (e.g., Cassandra, InfluxDB, Pi).
    • Strong experience in various databases / database technologies (SQL/NoSQL).
    • Python proficiency is a Must.
    • Strong proficiency in other languages (Python, C++, Java, SQL/NoSQL).
    • Familiarity with front-end web tier is a strong plus (e.g., JavaScript, AJAX, HTML, CSS, and cross browser development, specially modern frameworks such as React, Angular) Experience building secure software and an understanding of security techniques and algorithms.
    • Experience in designing and developing REST and/or SOAP based APIs.
    • Familiarity with communication protocols is a strong plus (TCP/IP, sockets).
    • Systems Software experience, including file systems, backend services, workflow engines, security, etc.
    • Deep understanding of object-oriented design, programming concepts, data structures and common algorithms.
    • Experience in Unix environments.
